Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Needle
Description: Small needle with a round cross-section, short and curved in shape with a wide and flat eye and a tapered tip. Like L 2316, this object was found in a tomb, beside the deceased's body, in this particular case on the shroud and in front of the legs. It is therefore impossible to ascertain whether this object was a tool or a pin used to hold fabrics together.
